meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by leukocytes.
meanings.sent1: The leukotic response helped fight off the infection.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained the leukotic nature of the immune system.
meanings.sent3: The leukotic warriors in the body were ready for battle.
meanings.sent4: Her courage was as leukotic as a soldier on the front lines.
meanings.sent5: The white blood cells stood out as the leukotic defenders of health.

meanings.sent1: The leukotic behavior of the cells surprised the researchers.
meanings.sent2: The medication aimed to enhance the leukotic abilities of the body.
meanings.sent3: The leukotic characteristics of the cells made them stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as leukotic as the strongest immune response.
meanings.sent5: The leukotic traits of the cells were crucial for fighting infections.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to white blood cells.
meanings.sent1: The leukotic count in the blood test was normal.
meanings.sent2: The doctor discussed the leukotic functions of white blood cells.
meanings.sent3: The leukotic soldiers in the bloodstream were on high alert.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was as leukotic as the body's defense system.
meanings.sent5: The leukotic properties of white blood cells were essential for immunity.
